intro: Crepis stenotheca, commonly known as the narrow-throated hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its yellow flowers appear in late summer. The species is notable for its narrow, elongated flower head, which gives it its common name.
